body:
I might not have been clear about this, but I'm against removing a working test for a still existing, although deprecated, feature. What added value does converting a tested feature into an untested feature provide?

IMHO this one should be reverted and should have been closed from the beginning.

> But sernum is not unsupported? It is only deprecated.

Sorry, I thought it was unsupported. I'd be happy to revert it, but perhaps it's a good time to retire senum for good? It's been more than 5 years since the deprecation. We should either remove it or un-deprecate it.

Agree,  but as I wrote in JIRA we should first do our homework and check if fbthrift still supports it, for sake of compatibility. Could be worth filing an fbthrift ticket, if they still have it, so we get rid of it on both ends. And while we're at it, we could also do the same for ```slist```
Done.
Merged, thanks!
@xionglailea could you rebase? And since this is a bug fix I think we should also have a JIRA ticket.
No further feedback, so closing. Feel free to reopen if more info becomes available..
This looks interesting, can it move forward?
The Jira ticket is at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-4977
I found a problem with it. Please stop.

Tests are failing:

```
> Task :compileCrossTestJava FAILED
/thrift/src/lib/java/test/org/apache/thrift/test/TestClient.java:80: error: cannot find symbol
    boolean http_client = fasle;
                          ^
  symbol:   variable fasle
  location: class TestClient
```

[Tests](https://travis-ci.org/apache/thrift/jobs/578865345) are failing:

```
Makefile:1371: recipe for target 'SecurityFromBufferTest.o' failed
make[5]: *** [SecurityFromBufferTest.o] Error 1
```
Thanks for stepping in @HIRANO-Satoshi ! Its highly appreciated!

> [Tests](https://travis-ci.org/apache/thrift/jobs/578865345) are failing:
> 
> ```
> Makefile:1371: recipe for target 'SecurityFromBufferTest.o' failed
> make[5]: *** [SecurityFromBufferTest.o] Error 1
> ```

Missing an include, and our tests did not pick it up, sorry. This should be fixed in the latest revision.
Merged, thanks for the PR!
Dear all, I'm curious if the issue described in mozilla/pdf.js#1955 still exists and is relevant in this context? Or could this PR be reconsidered?
@kainjow: Possible to rebase against current master?

Hey @johnboiles, would you be willing to continue this work? Your lookup table is very useful and getting rid of both `cpp.ref` and pointer-to-pointer cases (maps & slices) would be great, especially since 0.13 has just been released, making this the best possible time for backwards incompatible changes.
ping
Oh, I accidentally closed this PR when I was going to rebase it. I'll submit another PR since it doesn't seem that I can reopen it.
Yes I will.
ping

Going to solve that in a different way, see pull request #1902. You may close this one. 

Aside from that: Thanks for pointing it out.
@dcelasun  updated to fix that problem
Please don't introduce a custom logger, the Go ecosystem already has too many of those. Just use `log`, users can redirect it with `log.SetLogger` if they want to.
@dcelasun I removed the logging part, I still think we should make that change but I'll open a new JIRA ticket to discuss that. Please take another look.

I've checked the PR in more detail and found that the code for the binary protocol is not up to date for current thrift anymore. It may be simpler to start over based on the nodejs thrift implementation than to update this PR. Since the original code for this PR seems not maintained anymore, I suggest to leave the PR closed.
@dcelasun
@dcelasun I added comments regarding why do we ignore EOF errors, as per discussion in the ticket.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed in 7 days if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

Tests [are broken](https://api.travis-ci.org/v3/job/602924209/log.txt):

```
GOPATH=`pwd`/gopath /usr/local/bin/go build \
			includestest \
			binarykeytest \
			servicestest \
			typedeffieldtest \
			refannotationfieldstest \
			errortest	\
			namestest \
			initialismstest \
			dontexportrwtest \
			ignoreinitialismstest \
			unionbinarytest \
			conflictnamespacetestsuperthing \
			conflict/context/conflict_service-remote
GOPATH=`pwd`/gopath /usr/local/bin/go test thrift tests dontexportrwtest
ok  	thrift	0.071s
2019/10/29 09:02:20 error processing request: Service name not found in message name: returnTwo.  Did you forget to use a TMultiplexProtocol in your client?
Hi!
2019/10/29 09:02:20 error processing request: TException
--- FAIL: TestTJSONProtocol (0.00s)
    thrifttest_driver.go:224: TestException Xception failed
2019/10/29 09:02:20 error processing request: TException
--- FAIL: TestTBinaryProtocol (0.01s)
    thrifttest_driver.go:224: TestException Xception failed
2019/10/29 09:02:20 error processing request: TException
--- FAIL: TestTCompactProtocol (0.01s)
    thrifttest_driver.go:224: TestException Xception failed
FAIL
FAIL	tests	0.412s
ok  	dontexportrwtest	0.003s
```
I'd love ro commit this, but ... see above.

@toddlipcon I took a look at one of the test outputs and saw this:

```
org.apache.thrift.TestUnsafeBinaries > testSubStructValidation FAILED
4046    junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
4047WARNING: An illegal reflective access operation has occurred
4048WARNING: Illegal reflective access by org.mockito.cglib.core.ReflectUtils$2 (file:/root/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1/org.mockito/mockito-all/1.9.5/79a8984096fc6591c1e3690e07d41be506356fa5/mockito-all-1.9.5.jar) to method java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(java.lang.String,byte[],int,int,java.security.ProtectionDomain)
4049WARNING: Please consider reporting this to the maintainers of org.mockito.cglib.core.ReflectUtils$2
4050WARNING: Use --illegal-access=warn to enable warnings of further illegal reflective access operations
4051WARNING: All illegal access operations will be denied in a future release
4052
4053org.apache.thrift.TestStruct > testSubStructValidation FAILED
4054    junit.framework.AssertionFailedError at TestStruct.java:383
4055
4056org.apache.thrift.TestReuse > testSubStructValidation FAILED
4057    junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
4058
4059191 tests completed, 3 failed
4060
4061> Task :test FAILED
4062
4063FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.
```

[testSubStructValidation](https://github.com/apache/thrift/blob/af7ecd6a2b15efe5c6b742cf4a9ccb31bcc1f362/lib/java/test/org/apache/thrift/TestStruct.java#L365) failed for Java and this tests StructA and StructB which have been changed in this PR.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed in 7 days if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
@Jens-G @jeking3 backed out some changes which were causing the tests to fail that I don't understand yet, now it's simpler and passing.

Dear @pprice , your PR seems valuable, could you make further progress with the travis checks? If not, do you want to try and split it into smaller logical chunks? This can help isolate what breaks travis and maybe move ahead with the other parts more quickly?
This issue is no longer stale. Thank you for your contributions.
Thanks, looking at it!
This issue has been automatically closed due to inactivity. Thank you for your contributions.

AppVeyor failing due to:

> [00:17:28]   Generating TestServer, TestClient
[00:17:28]   <command line>: cannot satisfy -package hashable
[00:17:28]       (use -v for more information)

Travis:

> cabal: unrecognized 'build' option `--only-dependencies'
> 
> unrecognized 'build' option `--enable-tests'
Well, ist still says "Microsoft.CppCommon.targets(171,5): error MSB6006: "cmd.exe" exited with code 1."?
I'd wish that we had a bit more communication here. Next time I just close this w/o merging.
http://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute
I think the Linux jobs are using an older Cabal version while the MSVC one uses Chocolately to pull down the latest which now works differently. Trying a different fix in #1915.
It might be nice to update the LANGUAGES.md file for the Python/Domain column.
It passed!
Closing in favor of #1915, although we could try bringing this logic back but have CMake check the cabal/ghc version and still keep the existing older cabal logic.
@kainjow Thanks for the comment! Just updated the PR.
Great!
Thanks!
@dcelasun I fixed the broken test. PTAL.
@dcelasun Sorry we have to do this yet again :(
@dcelasun

The AppVeyor build failed. 

```
Creating library build\temp.win-amd64-3.6\Release\src/ext\fastbinary.cp36-win_amd64.lib and object build\temp.win-amd64-3.6\Release\src/ext\fastbinary.cp36-win_amd64.exp
  Generating code
  Finished generating code
  Building Custom Rule C:/projects/thrift/lib/py/CMakeLists.txt
Command exited with code 1
```

I'd like you to explain the change in more detail at the existing JIRA ticket. I will not commit this and I'm against it unless we made clear whether this is a legitimate change or not.

-1 so far
Merged, thanks for the PR!
Was this issue fixed? I have been facing this in 0.11.0

i'm sorry that i didn't review this p/r since i commit it. recently, i found another bug in thrift-lua Tcompact.lua file. then i think back this p/r. 
i will commit the new p/r after i read the doc.  Feel so sorry to waste your time.
cc @allengeorge
Will take a look.
Adding some more test cases, will send new PR.
The CI shows errors. How do we proceed?
It seems CI errors are unrelated to my change though. Do you have a way to retrigger the builds to see if they are reproductible?
Any news here?
On hold, since I want to do some more tests before I merge this.
@xhiroyukki: Could you explain please?

Can we have a ticket with a test case?
http://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute
LGTM +1
any progress?
Tests are [all green on my fork](https://travis-ci.org/dcelasun/thrift/builds/614535616), so I'll merge this right away.
I've updated the ticket with more details.
Thanks for the PR,  am looking at it.

Test - absolutely! I've added a new test class for TIOStreamTransport as there didn't seem to be unit tests for this class.

If the Travis CI bot is happy, then I'll squash this to a single commit.

Thank you guys for the contribution.
I also spot something unclear in the javadoc, will submit a PR to fix it.
PR for fixing the java doc: [THRIFT-5031](https://github.com/apache/thrift/pull/1948)

It seems my changes are failing in AppVeyor in unrelated topics.
```/cygdrive/c/projects/thrift/compiler/cpp/test/compiler/staleness_check.py``` I did not touch this file yet it says that it is missing.
How do we kick off CI again?
merged

> How do we kick off CI again?

Create an empty commit or merge master.
It seems after rebasing with the master branch travis is now happy
From what i see the travis-ci is failing only on some c++ thing and these changes are unrelated to c++.

> Can we have a ticket with a test case?
> http://thrift.apache.org/docs/HowToContribute

Any news?

Appveyor CI seems to be failing for an unrelated reason. The test case in `compiler/cpp/test/compiler/staleness_check.py` seems to be failing, possibly because it is trying to run a python3 test using python2.7.
@ctubbsii Are you willing and able to provide a +1 on this change?
Still open ... any issues?
We should define "trivial" somewhere ...
No explanation, no ticket, no merge.

The explanation was provided:

If a binary string contains non-utf8 decodable characters, this will cause an exception.
Still open? Any issues?

The Travis complaints are style based but related to this patch:

`# Python code style
flake8
./test/py/TestReverseTunnel.py:35:1: E302 expected 2 blank lines, found 1
./test/py/TestReverseTunnel.py:37:9: F401 'glob' imported but unused
./test/py/TestReverseTunnel.py:57:13: E265 block comment should start with '# '
./test/py/TestReverseTunnel.py:58:13: E265 block comment should start with '# '
./test/py/TestReverseTunnel.py:92:1: E305 expected 2 blank lines after class or function definition, found 1
./lib/py/src/server/TReverseTunnelServer.py:22:1: E265 block comment should start with '# '
./lib/py/src/server/TReverseTunnelServer.py:24:1: E302 expected 2 blank lines, found 1
./lib/py/src/server/TReverseTunnelServer.py:67:9: E265 block comment should start with '# '
./lib/py/src/server/TReverseTunnelServer.py:71:1: E302 expected 2 blank lines, found 1
The command "build/docker/run.sh" exited with 1.`

Simple to fix so probably worth fixing.

One unrelated test failure... I've seen this same test on my other PRs.

`The following tests FAILED:
	421 - StalenessCheckTest (Failed)`
@belugabehr I gave my +1 above already, but I'm not a committer on Thrift, so my opinion is just advisory.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed in 7 days if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
This is still important to me. Is there anything that I can help with to move this along?
This issue is no longer stale. Thank you for your contributions.

LGTM, but I don't personally use the Python library, so I'll leave this open for comments from other maintainers for 24 hours before merging.

@elprans can you please rebase from master?

thrift 0.13 can't be required in nodejs, it return throw error `MODULE_NOT_FOUND` when use this code
```sh
node -pe 'require("thrift")'
```
console log
```log
internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:800
    throw err;
    ^

Error: Cannot find module 'thrift'
Require stack:
- /work/github.com/shynome/thrift-server/[eval]
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:797:15)
    at Function.Module._load (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:690:27)
    at Module.require (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:852:19)
    at require (internal/modules/cjs/helpers.js:74:18)
    at [eval]:1:1
    at Script.runInThisContext (vm.js:116:20)
    at Object.runInThisContext (vm.js:306:38)
    at Object.<anonymous> ([eval]-wrapper:9:26)
    at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:959:30)
    at evalScript (internal/process/execution.js:80:25) {
  code: 'MODULE_NOT_FOUND',
  requireStack: [ '/work/github.com/shynome/thrift-server/[eval]' ]
}
```
